口塞ぎ: (くちふさぎ) - prohibition of speaking; imposition of silence; tiny morsel
口外: (こうがい) - disclosure; reveal (i.e. a secret)
口奇麗: (くちぎれい) - speaking elegantly; speaking clearly; not coveting food; speaking like an innocent person
口寂しい: (くちさびしい) - longing to have or put something in one's mouth
口寄: (くちよせ) - spiritualism/spiritism/channeling/summoning a spirit and giving him voice (esp. when done by a female shaman); medium/channeler
口寄せ: (くちよせ) - spiritualism/spiritism/channeling/summoning a spirit and giving him voice (esp. when done by a female shaman); medium/channeler
口尻: (くちじり) - commissures (of the lips); lip corners; mouth corners
口巾ったい: (くちはばったい) - acting smart; bragging
口座振替: (こうざふりかえ) - direct debit; account-to-account transfer
口座番号: (こうざばんごう) - account number (bank, etc.)
口座自動振替: (こうざじどうふりかえ) - direct debit; account-to-account transfer
口当たり: (くちあたり) - taste; smooth talking; reception/hospitality
口径比: (こうけいひ) - aperture ratio (inverse of the f-number); relative aperture
口性ない: (くちさがない) - gossipy; abusive; critical; jabbering
口性無い: (くちさがない) - gossipy; abusive; critical; jabbering
口惜しい: (くちおしい) - vexing; annoying; frustrating; regrettable; mortifying
口慣らし: (くちならし) - accustoming oneself to a certain taste; oral drill
口承: (こうしょう) - passing on by word of mouth; oral tradition
口承文学: (こうしょうぶんがく) - oral literature; oral tradition
口承文芸: (こうしょうぶんげい) - oral literature; folklore
口拍子: (くちびょうし) - counting time orally
口振: (こうふり) - direct debit; account-to-account transfer
口振り: (くちぶり) - way of speaking; intimation
口授: (くじゅ) - oral instruction or teaching or method
口数: (こうすう) - number of people, items, etc.; population
口数が多い: (くちかずがおおい) - (ant: 口数が少ない) talkative
口数が少ない: (くちかずがすくない) - (ant: 口数が多い) taciturn
口明け: (くちあけ) - opening (of a bottle)/broaching; beginning/opening/commencement (e.g. of sales)/first sale
口書: (くちがき) - writing with the brush in one's mouth; foreword/preface; affidavit/written confession (of a commoner in the Edo period)
口書き: (くちがき) - writing with the brush in one's mouth; foreword/preface; affidavit/written confession (of a commoner in the Edo period)
口止め: (くちどめ) - forbidding to speak/muzzling (a person)/bribing into secrecy; hush money
口汚し: (くちよごし) - tantalizing sample (of food); tantalising sample (of food)
口淫: (こういん) - oral sex; fellatio; cunnilingus
口添え: (くちぞえ) - recommendation; putting in a good word for someone
口渇: (こうかつ) - thirst; dry mouth; dipsia
口減らし: (くちべらし) - giving up children for adoption or apprenticeship, etc. (out of poverty); reducing the number of mouths
口火: (くちび) - fuse; spark plug; cause (of war); origin (of a quarrel)
口火を切る: (くちびをきる) - to start the debate; to get the ball rolling; to fire the first shot (fig. only); to start a conversation
口無し: (くちなし) - something unspoken; non-functional mouth
口煩い: (くちうるさい) - nagging; faultfinding; carping; captious
口煩さい: (くちうるさい) - nagging; faultfinding; carping; captious
口琴: (びやぼん) - Edo-period mouth harp (with a hairpin-like frame and a long straight tongue)
口癖: (kuchiguse) - expressão querida, frase favorita (predileta), frase feita; jeito de falar
口白鹿: (クチジロジカ) - Thorold's deer (Cervus albirostris); white-lipped deer
口直し: (くちなおし) - removing a bad taste/cleansing one's palate; palate cleanser/intermezzo/dish or beverage to cleanse one's palate between dishes of a meal
口相撲: (くちずもう) - war of words/verbal fisticuffs; kissing
口称: (くしょう) - chanting the invocation to Amida Buddha
口称念仏: (くしょうねんぶつ) - chanting an invocation (to Amida Buddha); reciting a prayer
口移し: (くちうつし) - mouth-to-mouth feeding; conveying by word of mouth/oral tradition
口程にもない: (くちほどにもない) - all bark and no bite; unable to live up to one's claims
口程にも無い: (くちほどにもない) - all bark and no bite; unable to live up to one's claims
口答試問: (こうとうしもん) - oral examination; interview
口篭る: (くちごもる) - to hesitate to say; to mumble; to hem and haw; to falter
口籠もる: (くちごもる) - to hesitate to say; to mumble; to hem and haw; to falter
口籠る: (くちごもる) - to hesitate to say; to mumble; to hem and haw; to falter
口約束: (くちやくそく) - verbal promise; one's word
口紐: (くちひも) - drawstring (e.g. on a bag)
口細: (くちぼそ) - having a small mouth/eating only a little; topmouth gudgeon (Pseudorasbora parva); barracuda
